data.author: local-user
data.name: Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
data.description: A stretch to lengthen the hip flexors and improve mobility in the hips and lower back.
data.notes: Keep your torso upright and avoid overarching your lower back.
instructions: Kneel on one leg with the other foot in front, knee bent at 90 degrees.
Keep torso upright and engage core.
Gently push hips forward until a stretch is felt in the front of the hip.
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Child’s Pose
data.description: A gentle stretch that lengthens the spine, relaxes the lower back, and opens the hips.
data.notes: Breathe deeply and relax your shoulders away from your ears.
instructions: Kneel on the mat with big toes touching and knees apart.
Sit back onto your heels.
Reach your arms forward and lower your torso toward the mat.
Relax your forehead on the mat and breathe deeply.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Supine Twist
data.description: A lying spinal twist that stretches the lower back, obliques, and promotes spinal mobility.
data.notes: Keep shoulders flat on the floor and avoid forcing the twist.
instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended out to the sides.
Bend your right knee and bring it across your body toward the floor on the left side.
Keep both shoulders in contact with the floor.
Turn your head gently to the right and hold the stretch.
Repeat on the other side.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Doorway Pec Stretch
data.description: A chest-opening stretch performed using a doorway to target the pectoral muscles and improve shoulder mobility.
data.notes: Keep neck relaxed and avoid leaning forward excessively.
instructions: Stand in a doorway and place your forearm on the door frame with your elbow at shoulder height.
Step forward with one foot to feel a stretch across your chest.
Keep torso upright and avoid arching your back.
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Wall Pec Minor Stretch
data.description: A stretch targeting the pec minor and front of the shoulders to help improve posture and shoulder mobility.
data.notes: Focus on a gentle stretch—avoid forcing the movement.
instructions: Stand next to a wall with your arm straight up and palm facing forward.
Place your hand against the wall and rotate your torso slightly away from it.
Keep your shoulder relaxed and feel the stretch in the front of your shoulder and chest.
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Upper Trap Stretch
data.description: A neck stretch that targets the upper trapezius to relieve tension and improve neck mobility.
data.notes: Keep shoulders relaxed and avoid pulling too hard on the head.
instructions: Sit or stand tall with your back straight.
Tilt your head to one side, bringing your ear toward your shoulder.
Use your hand on the same side to gently deepen the stretch.
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Levator Scapulae Stretch
data.description: A stretch to relieve tension in the levator scapulae, a muscle that runs along the side and back of the neck.
data.notes: Do not force the stretch; keep the movement gentle and controlled.
instructions: Sit or stand tall with your back straight.
Turn your head about 45 degrees toward one side.
Gently lower your chin toward your armpit.
Place your hand on the back of your head and apply gentle pressure to deepen the stretch.
Hold for 30 seconds, then switch sides.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Neck Flexion Stretch (Chin to Chest)
data.description: A gentle stretch for the muscles along the back of the neck, promoting flexibility and reducing stiffness.
data.notes: Avoid rounding the shoulders; keep the stretch gentle.
instructions: Sit or stand with your back straight.
Slowly lower your chin toward your chest.
Keep shoulders relaxed and avoid slouching.
Hold the position for 30 seconds while breathing deeply.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Glute Bridge
data.description: A lower-body exercise that targets the glutes, hamstrings, and core. Can be performed with bodyweight or with added resistance from a dumbbell.
data.notes: Keep your core engaged and avoid arching your lower back.
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
Place a dumbbell across your hips if using resistance.
Engage your core and squeeze your glutes as you lift your hips toward the ceiling.
Pause at the top, then slowly lower back down.
Repeat for the desired number of reps.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Crunches (on mat)
data.description: A core exercise focusing on the rectus abdominis, improving abdominal strength and endurance.
data.notes: Avoid pulling your neck forward; movement should come from the abs.
instructions: Lie on your back on a mat with knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
Place your hands behind your head or crossed over your chest.
Engage your core and lift your shoulder blades off the floor.
Lower slowly back down and repeat.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Wall Head Press
data.description: An isometric neck and upper back strengthening exercise to improve posture and counteract forward head position.
data.notes: Keep your chin slightly tucked and avoid tilting your head up or down.
instructions: Stand with your back against a wall, feet shoulder-width apart.
Place the back of your head gently against the wall.
Tuck your chin slightly and press your head into the wall without moving it.
Hold for the prescribed time, then relax.
Repeat for the set duration.

data.author: local-user
data.name: Chin Tucks
data.description: A posture correction exercise that strengthens deep neck flexors and reduces forward head posture.
data.notes: Movement should be subtle — avoid bending your neck forward.
instructions: Sit or stand tall with shoulders relaxed.
Gently tuck your chin toward your neck without looking down.
Hold for 2–3 seconds, then release.
Repeat for the set number of reps.

data.author: local-user
data.name: TRX Rows
data.description: A bodyweight pulling exercise using TRX straps to strengthen the upper back, lats, and biceps.
data.notes: Keep your core tight and avoid shrugging your shoulders during the pull.
instructions: Anchor your TRX straps securely.
Hold the handles with palms facing each other and walk your feet forward to set your desired angle.
Keep your body straight from head to heels.
Pull your chest toward the handles by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Lower back down with control and repeat.

data.author: local-user
data.name: TRX Face Pulls
data.description: A TRX pulling exercise targeting the rear delts, traps, and external rotators for better posture and shoulder stability.
data.notes: Lead the pull with your elbows high and keep your wrists straight.
instructions: Anchor the TRX straps securely.
Hold the handles with an overhand grip and walk your feet forward until your body is at a slight angle.
With arms extended, engage your core and pull the handles toward your face, leading with your elbows high and out to the sides.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
Lower back with control and repeat.

data.author: local-user
data.name: TRX Reverse Flys
data.description: A TRX exercise that strengthens the rear delts, rhomboids, and upper back by pulling the arms outward in a reverse fly motion.
data.notes: Keep a slight bend in your elbows and move in a controlled manner to avoid swinging.
instructions: Anchor the TRX straps securely.
Hold the handles with palms facing each other and walk your feet forward to set your angle.
Keep your arms straight or with a slight bend in the elbows.
Pull your arms outward in a wide arc until they are in line with your shoulders, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Return to the start position slowly and repeat.
